column4: Tesla CEO Musk accused in lawsuit of defrauding shareholders
column5: Aug 10 Tesla Inc and Chief Executive Elon Musk were sued on Friday by an investor who said they defrauded shareholders in a scheme to manipulate the electric car company's stock price  starting with Musk's Aug. 7 tweet that he might take Tesla private.

column4: Exclusive: Tesla's board seeking more information on Musk's financing plan - sources
column5: Tesla Inc's  board has not yet received a detailed financing plan from CEO Elon Musk  and is seeking more information about how he will take the U.S. electric car maker private in a proposed deal worth $72 billion  people familiar with the matter said on Thursday. | Video

column4: BUZZ- U.S. stocks weekly: Turkey melt
column5: ** S&P 500 snaps 5-week win streak  dips 0.25 pct  as Turkey's financial crisis and deepening rift with U.S. roil markets worldwide on Fri

column4: Timeline: Main events in Tesla's history as a public company
column5: Here are some of the key events in Tesla Inc's  turbulent history as a public company.

column4: REFILE-TIMELINE-Main events in Tesla's history as a public company
column5: Aug 10 Here are some of the key events in Tesla Inc's turbulent history as a public company. June 29  2010 - Chief Executive Elon Musk and team ring the Nasdaq opening bell as Tesla becomes the first car company to go public in the United States since Ford Motor Co in 1956.

column4: Doug Field  former Tesla engineering chief  returns to Apple
column5: SAN FRANCISCO Doug Field  who stepped down as the senior vice president of engineering at Tesla Inc  last month  is returning to Apple Inc   Apple told Reuters on Thursday.

column4: CORRECTED-Doug Field  former Tesla engineering chief  returns to Apple
column5: SAN FRANCISCO  Aug 9 Doug Field  who stepped down as the senior vice president of engineering at Tesla Inc last month  is returning to Apple Inc  Apple told Reuters on Thursday.

column4: Tesla short-sellers back in force as shares remain shaky
column5: NEW YORK The number of Tesla Inc  shares sold short has rebounded and are now higher than before CEO Elon Musk proposed on Tuesday taking the electric car maker private  according to data from financial technology and analytics firm S3 Partners.

column4: Qualcomm settles anti-trust case with Taiwan regulator for $93 million
column5: TAIPEI/SAN FRANCISCO Mobile chipmaker Qualcomm Inc  will settle an anti-trust case with Taiwanese regulators for about $93 million  and has also pledged to invest $700 million in Taiwan over the next five years. | Video

column4: UPDATE 2-Qualcomm settles anti-trust case with Taiwan regulator for $93 mln
column5: * Mediatek says decision will have negative impact on 5G industry (Adds Mediatek comment)

column4: Qualcomm settles with Taiwan antitrust regulator for T$2.73 bln
column5: TAIPEI  Aug 10 Mobile chipmaker Qualcomm Inc is settling an antitrust case brought against it by Taiwan regulators by paying T$2.73 billion ($89 million)  the island's Fair Trade Commission said on Friday.
